Config.overview: This course will teach you the essentials of parachuting, including the gear, jump and emergency procedures

Lesson.name: The Parachute Rig
Lesson.Context: This lesson covers the elements of the parachute rig, so you know where everything is.

LessonElements.Element: Your rig must have a main and reserve. These should be inspected yearly.
Located right side, chest height. Pull outwards with right-hand, not crossbody.
Silver Handle, Located left side, hip height.

LessonResources.Resource: Diagram of parachute focussing on handle colour and location.

Lesson.ApplicationScenario: The student is at the dropzone, and they are given a new parachute. What should they check for, and where will they find it?

Lesson.name: The Altimeter
Lesson.Context: This lesson looks at the altimeter.

LessonElements.Element: We need to check alitmeter every 5 seconds during freefall
Always set Altimeter so that zero matches dropzone elevation.
5,000ft AGL: Start of the Decision Window, reaching down to 3,000 feet
3,000ft AGL: Essential parachute is deployed to allow time to reserve deployment in case of failure.

LessonResources.Resource: Example image of a wrist altimeter.
Diagram of the decision window, showing altitude heights.

Lesson.ApplicationScenario: The student is at 6,000 feet. What are their actions over the next few seconds?

Lesson.name: Danger Conditions
Lesson.Context: This lesson highlights weather conditions that might impact or prevent a jump.

LessonElements.Element: These clouds cabn be lethal for jumpers due to updrafts, turbluence, rain, hail etc. Jumping is prohibited if there are cumulonimbus clouds within 10 miles of the dropzone.
No boarding if cloud cover is below 2,000ft AGL
Maximum ground wind speed at drop zone of 20 knots

LessonResources.Resource: Ref Image of cunim (thunderhead) cloud formation.
Ref Image of low cloud over dropzone.
Ref image of windsock and anemometer.

Lesson.ApplicationScenario: The student is at the dropzone, on a cloudy and blustery day. What should they check for?

Lesson.name: Water Landings
Lesson.Context: This lesson looks at the dangers of (and correct process for) water landings.

LessonElements.Element: Landing in water is a dangerous activity. Jumpers has become cocooned in the chute fabric and lines and have drowned.
Airborne Action: Unclip chest strap. Water Contact Action: Unclip leg straps only upon touching water. Reasoning: Prevents harness fall-out while avoiding cocooning.

LessonResources.Resource: Example image of a parachute in the water.
Diagram of the correct approach to a water landing.

Lesson.ApplicationScenario: The student is at 1,500 feet in a coastal location. An offshore wind is blowing. What are their actions over the next few minutes?
